1. Cook the Lentils: Rinse the lentils and place them in a pot with water. Bring to a boil and then simmer for about 20-30 minutes, or until tender. Drain any excess water.
2. Prepare the Ham: Dice the ham into small cubes. In a separate pan, heat a little oil over medium heat and sauté the ham until it becomes crispy and golden.

3. Combine and Season: Add the cooked lentils to the pan with the ham. Stir well and cook for a few more minutes, adding salt, pepper, and any other desired spices (such as garlic or paprika) to taste. Serve hot.
1. Prepare the Pork Ribs: Season the pork ribs with salt, pepper, and your favorite spices. Heat a little oil in a pan and sear the ribs on all sides until browned. Set aside.
2. Cook the Potatoes: Peel and chop the potatoes into cubes. In the same pan, add more oil if needed and sauté the potatoes until golden and crispy on the outside, about 10-15 minutes.

3. Combine and Simmer: Add the seared pork ribs back into the pan with the potatoes. Add a bit of water or broth, cover, and let it cook for about 40 minutes, or until the pork is tender and the potatoes are fully cooked.
1. Clean the Chanterelles: Gently clean the chanterelles with a damp cloth or soft brush to remove any dirt. Trim the tough ends of the stems if necessary.

2. Sauté the Mushrooms: Heat a pan over medium heat and add a little butter or oil. Once hot, add the chanterelles and sauté them for about 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they release their moisture and become golden brown.

3. Season and Serve: Add salt, pepper, and any desired herbs (like thyme or parsley) to taste. Continue cooking for another 2 minutes, then serve the chanterelles as a side dish or as a topping for meats or pasta.
1. Prepare the Pork Cutlet: Bread the pork cutlet (tonkatsu) by coating it with flour, dipping it in beaten egg, and covering it with breadcrumbs. Fry it in oil until golden and crispy. Set aside.
2. Make the Broth: In a pan, combine dashi stock, soy sauce, mirin, and sugar. Bring to a simmer.

3. Cook the Egg: Slice the pork cutlet and place it in the pan with the simmering broth. Pour beaten eggs over the cutlet and cover the pan. Cook until the eggs are set. Serve over a bowl of cooked rice.
1. Cook the Beans: Soak the red beans overnight, then cook them in a pot with water until tender (about 1.5–2 hours), or use canned beans for convenience.
2. Sauté the Plantain: In a pan, fry the diced plantain in oil until golden and slightly caramelized.
3. Combine and Season: Add the cooked beans and plantain to a pot. Stir in the hogao (Colombian creole sauce) and cook for 10–15 minutes to let the flavors combine. Serve hot.
1. Sauté the Chicken: Season the chicken thighs with salt and pepper. In a large pot, brown them on both sides in oil. Remove and set aside.
2. Cook the Rice: In the same pot, sauté the mixed vegetables until softened. Add the rice and stir for a minute. Pour in chicken stock and bring to a boil.
3. Combine and Simmer: Place the chicken back into the pot with the rice. Lower the heat, cover, and cook until the rice is tender and the chicken is fully cooked. Serve warm.
1. Sauté the Vegetables: In a pan, heat oil and sauté the diced red bell pepper and onion until softened.
2. Cook the Squid: Add the sliced squid to the pan and cook for 3–5 minutes until slightly tender.
3. Simmer in Sauce: Pour in the tomato sauce and season with paprika, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15–20 minutes until the squid is tender and the flavors meld. Serve hot.
